summary: This bill, the American Patriots of WWII through Service with the Canadian and British Armed Forces Gold Medal Act of 2025, proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to all U.S. nationals who voluntarily served in the Canadian and British Armed Forces and their supporting entities during World War II. It acknowledges their contributions and sacrifices, highlighting their bravery and foresight. The medal will be placed in the Smithsonian Institution and duplicate bronze medals may be sold. The bill emphasizes the importance of recognizing these veterans' service and the unrecognized story of valor.
